articles.title: Top 4 news stories you need to know: August 7, 2025
articles.description: FOX 35's Garrett Wymer and Marlisa Goldsmith break down the top news stories of the day, including a federal judge's injunction pausing construction at Alligator Alcatraz, Israel's announcement of wanting control of Gaza, President Donald Trump ordering a new census, a bond hearing for a suspected killer, and Florida officials trying to stop a Dengue fever outbreak.

articles.title: Top U.S. & World Headlines â€” August 7, 2025
articles.description: President Trump is threatening to deploy the National Guard to Washington D.C. and take over the city's police department. Five soldiers were wounded in an attack at Fort Stewart, Georgia. Republican Congressman Mike Flood faced backlash during a town hall. Tariffs on over 90 countries took effect, with President Trump imposing high rates on India and Brazil. President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin may meet next week to discuss the war in Ukraine. A top UN official warned of catastrophic consequences for Israel's plans in Gaza. Israeli settlers attacked aid convoys, and Israeli attacks killed Palestinians. Doctors Without Borders called for the closure of US-backed aid centers in Gaza.

articles.title: Top Story with Tom Llamas - Aug. 7 | NBC News NOW
articles.description: President Trump's tariffs are in full effect for dozens of countries, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's announcement to take over Gaza has been met with backlash, and Instagram has a new feature allowing users to check friends' locations.
